key_title: Key to the species of Eremophila

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the genera of Myoporaceae

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Myoporaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Myoporaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Corolla zygomorphic; stamens 4
Corolla virtually actinomorphic; stamens 5
Corolla with upper lip 4-lobed, deeply separated from lower 1-lobed lip
Corolla with upper lip 2-lobed, lower lip 3-lobed or lobes more or less equal
Pedicels shorter than calyx, straight, stellate-hairy; sepals lanceolate; corolla not spotted
Pedicels much longer than calyx, sigmoidal, glabrous; sepals ovate; corolla usually spotted inside
Leaves more than 15 mm long (mostly more than 20 mm long); corolla variously coloured
Leaves less than 15 mm long (mostly less than 10 mm long); corolla blue or lilac
Prostrate shrubs; leaves commonly with a few large reflexed teeth basally
Decumbent to erect shrubs or small trees; leaves never with reflexed basal teeth
Calyx-lobes imbricate at base, ovate, acute, 3–4 mm wide
Calyx-lobes never imbricate at base, either less than 3 mm wide or obtuse
Leaves more than 5 cm long, mostly more than 4 mm wide; corolla creamy-white; stamens shortly exserted; fruit ovoid, 15–20 mm long; shrub or small tree, never divaricate
Leaves less than 5 cm long and 3 mm wide; corolla pinkish; stamens included; fruit narrow-obloid, c. 10 mm long; divaricate shrub
Leaves 1–3 mm wide, apex hooked; sepals oblanceolate, obtuse, more than 5 mm long; corolla white, pinkish or lilac; drupe dry, hoary-pubescent
Leaves more than 3 mm wide, apex straight; sepals lanceolate, acute, mostly c. 4 mm long; corolla dull red; drupe succulent, glabrous
Leaves often opposite, 3–9 cm long, hoary; calyx hoary; corolla 20 mm long or more, glabrous outside, white or suffused with pink
Leaves always alternate, less than 3 cm long, glabrous, viscid; calyx glabrous, vis- cid; corolla less than 15 mm long, pubescent outside, pale lilac
Plant glabrous, never silvery in appearance; leaves with apex blunt or straight, bases not decurrent; calyx lobes imbricate at base
Plant silvery in appearance from an indumentum of minute appressed scales; leaves with apex hooked, bases long-decurrent; calyx lobes never imbricate at base
Leaves ovate to oblong, less than 8 mm long; branchlets never spine-tipped; calyx 5-lobed; corolla less than 12 mm long, glabrous externally; drupe not longer than calyx

Leaves linear-lanceolate to -oblanceolate, mostly 5–15 mm long; branchlets sometimes spine-tipped; calyx usually 4-lobed; corolla usually 12–20 mm long, stellate-pubescent externally; drupe longer than calyx
Leaves ovate, obovate or orbicular, 4–8 mm long, decurved, flat or concave above, wrinkled below; drupe ovoid, succulent
Leaves oblong to cordiform, 2–5 mm long, erect and appressed, plano-convex, tuberculate below; drupe thin, flattened, almost dry
